alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Hancock; Seneca; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 1:24AM EDT until August 24 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Seneca County in northwestern Ohio... Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Crawford County in north central Ohio... Eastern Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 215 AM EDT. * At 124 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fostoria to near Sycamore to near Crestline, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Tiffin, Fostoria, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Galion, Crestline, Forest, New Washington, Bloomville, Sycamore, Arcadia, Vanlue, New Riegel, Chatfield, Carey, Benton, Nevada, Bettsville, Wharton and Tiro. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
